unable to reproduce. I launched a new empty workspace, and pressed the debug 
button. The dialog opened as expected with a list of config types, and nothing 
selected (and an empty edit area).

Please try with latest code. (Perhaps this is a linux thing).

Created an attachment (id=2534)
field.png - A screenshot of the problem

The mysterious text field still appears on my system. We tried reproducing it
on WinXP and didn't see the problem.

Jared, I modified the layout (there was an extra layer of composite that was 
not required). I am not convinced this will fix the problem, but please see if 
the problem still exists.

Re-assigning to re-verify. If this is not fixed, I will need you to track down 
the bug (since I cannot reproduce the problem on Windows).

If the dialog is opened and there are no configs, we don't select a config
type. On Win32, the tree viewer apparently selects the top item anyway. The
problem only appears if you launch the dialog with no selection (something
that can't be done on Win32).

You should be able to see the same problem on Windows if you open the dialog
with nothing in the launch config viewer. The easiest way to do this is
probably to open the dialog on a group that doesn't exist.

I've looked at the code and it looks busted. We only work on Windows because
of a fluke of native behavior. When we create the config editing area, we
create the widgets that show up in my screenshot. When we open the dialog
on Windows, the Win32 tree widget apparently sets a selection, which fires a
selection changed event. The dialog then reacts to this selection event and
makes the editing area invisible.

I experimented with fixing this by making sure that a selection is returned
in doInitialTreeSelection(). However, it turns out that if you select a
launch configuration type at this point (thus making the edit area invisible)
the launch config area fills the entire dialog and the edit area is gone.
This happens on Windows as well, but the edit area only disappears (in the 
bad way) when you resize the dialog.

Your fix introduced the bug I described above whereby if you resize the dialog
the config selection area fills the entire dialog.

The idea of creating the widgets and then setting the entire composite
invisible seems flawed in light of the behavior we're seeing (either that or
there's an SWT/JFace bug here).

Why are we creating the Name/Apply/Revert widgets so early, anyway? The tab
group doesn't show up until a config is actually selected. Can we do the
same for the offending widgets?
The resize bug did not happen on Windows. Ug.

The widgets have to be created in order to size the dialog properly. Then we 
hide them. We cannot compute the space needed, unless they exist.
Fixed by adding another top-level composite container. (ping).
